query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Ruppemi l’alto sonno ne la testa 2 un greve truono, sì ch’io mi riscossi 3 come persona ch’è per forza desta;
query.error: **English:** 1 A loud clap of thunder broke my deep sleep, 2 so that I woke up 3 like a person who is forcibly awakened;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 e l’occhio riposato intorno mossi, 5 dritto levato, e fiso riguardai 6 per conoscer lo loco dov’ io fossi.
query.error: **English:** 4 and I moved my rested eyes around, 5 standing up straight and looking intently 6 to recognize the place where I was.
query.result: 4 Cakṣuś ca viśrāntam idam idam paryāvartayām āsa, 5 Ūrdhvam utthitaḥ, niścitaṃ ca adhiśīlayām āsa 6 Jñātum sthānam yatra aham āsam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 Vero è che ’n su la proda mi trovai 8 de la valle d’abisso dolorosa 9 che ’ntrono accoglie d’infiniti guai.
query.error: **English:** 7 It is true that I found myself on the edge 8 of the dolorous valley of the abyss, 9 which gathers within it infinite woes.
query.result: 7 Satyam eva yathā aham ātmānam prāpa 8 duḥkhamayasya narakasyānte, 9 yasmin anantāni duḥkhāni samāhitāni santi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Oscura e profonda era e nebulosa 11 tanto che, per ficcar lo viso a fondo, 12 io non vi discernea alcuna cosa.
query.error: **English:** 10 Dark and deep and cloudy it was, 11 so much that, to describe it, 12 I cannot discern anything there.
query.result: 10 Andhakāramayī gambhīrā ca abhramālinī ca āsīt, 11 Yāvat, tad viṣayaṃ vaktuṃ, 12 Na kiṃcid api tatra viśeṣeṇa paśyāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 «Or discendiam qua giù nel cieco mondo», 14 cominciò il poeta tutto smorto. 15 «Io sarò primo, e tu sarai secondo».
query.error: **English:** 13 "Now let us descend down here into the blind world," 14 began the poet, all pale. 15 "I will be first, and you shall be second."
query.result: 13 "Adyaiva avataraṇam kuru adhastāt asmābhiḥ andhakāramayaṃ lokam prati", 14 ārabhata kaviḥ samastaḥ pītavarṇaḥ. 15 "Aham agre vartīṣye, tvam ca paścāt."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 E io, che del color mi fui accorto, 17 dissi: «Come verrò, se tu paventi 18 che suoli al mio dubbiare esser conforto?».
query.error: **English:** 16 And I, who had noticed my color, 17 said: "How shall I proceed, if you are afraid, 18 you who are accustomed to being a comfort to my doubts?"
query.result: 16 Aham ca yasya varṇam adhyagaccham, 17 uvāca: "Katham gamisyāmi, yadi tvam bibheṣi, 18 yaḥ mama saṃśaye sadā prītiḥ asi?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Ed elli a me: «L’angoscia de le genti 20 che son qua giù, nel viso mi dipigne 21 quella pietà che tu per tema senti.
query.error: **English:** 19 And he to me: "The anguish of the people 20 who are down here, in my face paints 21 that pity which you feel out of fear.
query.result: 19 Sa ca mama: "Duhkhaṃ janasya 20 Ye 'tra 'dhobhāḥ, mukhe me likhati 21 Tām kṛpāṃ yāṃ tvam bhayāt anubhavasi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Andiam, ché la via lunga ne sospigne». 23 Così si mise e così mi fé intrare 24 nel primo cerchio che l’abisso cigne.
query.error: **English:** 22 Let us go, for the long road impels us." 23 Thus he moved, and thus he made me enter 24 into the first circle that the abyss encircles.
query.result: 22 Gacchāva, yataḥ dīrghaḥ panthāḥ pracoditaḥ asmān." 23 Evam sa jagāma, evam ca mama prāveśanam akārayat 24 prathame cakre yaḥ abadhāḥ āveṣṭayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Quivi, secondo che per ascoltare, 26 non avea pianto mai che di sospiri 27 che l’aura etterna facevan tremare;
query.error: **English:** 25 There, according to what I could hear, 26 there was never any weeping, but only sighs 27 that made the eternal air tremble;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 ciò avvenia di duol sanza martìri, 29 ch’avean le turbe, ch’eran molte e grandi, 30 d’infanti e di femmine e di viri.
query.error: **English:** 28 this came from sorrow without torment, 29 which the crowds had, who were many and great, 30 of infants and women and men.
query.result: 28 etad abhavat duḥkhāt vinā piḍām, 29 yāḥ āsan janatāḥ, tāḥ āsan bahvyaḥ ca bṛhatyaś ca, 30 bālānāṃ ca strīṇāṃ ca puruṣāṇāṃ ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Lo buon maestro a me: «Tu non dimandi 32 che spiriti son questi che tu vedi? 33 Or vo’ che sappi, innanzi che più andi,
query.error: **English:** 31 The good master said to me: "Do you not ask 32 what spirits these are that you see? 33 Now I want you to know, before you go any further,
query.result: 31 Satguruḥ mama abravīt: "Tvaṃ na praśnasi 32 ke ete ātmānaḥ santi ye tvayā dṛṣṭāḥ? 33 Adhunā tvāṃ jānīhi, pūrvam eva yāvad gacchasi,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 ch’ei non peccaro; e s’elli hanno mercedi, 35 non basta, perché non ebber battesmo, 36 ch’è porta de la fede che tu credi;
query.error: **English:** 34 that they did not sin; and if they have mercy, 35 it is not enough, because they did not receive baptism, 36 which is the gate of the faith that you believe in;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 e s’e’ furon dinanzi al cristianesmo, 38 non adorar debitamente a Dio: 39 e di questi cotai son io medesmo.
query.error: **English:** 37 and if they were before Christianity, 38 they did not worship God properly: 39 and I myself am one of these.
query.result: 37 ca yadi ete pūrvam eva mlecchatvāt, 38 na Devāya yathāvat pūjām akurvan: 39 ca eteṣāṃ tādṛśeṣu aham api asmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Per tai difetti, non per altro rio, 41 semo perduti, e sol di tanto offesi 42 che sanza speme vivemo in disio».
query.error: **English:** 40 For these defects, not for any other harm, 41 we are lost, and only so much offended 42 that we live without hope in desire.
query.result: 40 Eteṣāṃ doṣāṇāṃ nimittaṃ nānyaṃ pāpaṃ, 41 asmākaṃ naṣṭatvam, evaṃ caivāparādhaḥ, 42 yena niṣphalaṃ jīvitam icchāyāṃ vartate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Gran duol mi prese al cor quando lo ’ntesi, 44 però che gente di molto valore 45 conobbi che ’n quel limbo eran sospesi.
query.error: **English:** 43 Great sorrow seized my heart when I heard it, 44 because I recognized people of great worth 45 who were suspended in that limbo.
query.result: 43 Mahān duḥkhaṃ me prāpa hṛdi yadā tat aśrauṣam, 44 yataḥ mahāpuruṣāṇāṃ bahūn 45 ajānāṃ tan mṛtaloke liṅge sthitān.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 «Dimmi, maestro mio, dimmi, segnore», 47 comincia’ io per voler esser certo 48 di quella fede che vince ogne errore:
query.error: **English:** 46 "Tell me, my master, tell me, my lord," 47 I began, wanting to be certain 48 of that faith which conquers every error:
query.result: 46 "Bruhi me, gurudeva, bruhi me, bhagavan," 47 ārabdhaḥ aham satyavijñānārtham 48 tasya viśvāsyasya yaḥ sarvapāpaghnaḥ:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 «uscicci mai alcuno, o per suo merto 50 o per altrui, che poi fosse beato?». 51 E quei che ’ntese il mio parlar coverto,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 rispuose: «Io era nuovo in questo stato, 53 quando ci vidi venire un possente, 54 con segno di vittoria coronato.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 Trasseci l’ombra del primo parente, 56 d’Abèl suo figlio e quella di Noè, 57 di Moïsè legista e ubidente;

query.result: 55 Tatra ādi-pitur chāyāṃ, 56 Tasya putrasya Ābelasya ca, Noasya ca, 57 Niyamena vartataḥ śāstrajñasya ca Mosesasya,

58 Abraàm patrïarca e Davìd re, 59 Israèl con lo padre e co’ suoi nati 60 e con Rachele, per cui tanto fé,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 e altri molti, e feceli beati. 62 E vo’ che sappi che, dinanzi ad essi, 63 spiriti umani non eran salvati».
query.error: **English:** 61 and many others, and made them blessed. 62 And I want you to know that, before them, 63 no human spirits were saved."
query.result: 61 Evaṃ ca anye bahvaḥ, tān ca sarvān sukhamān cakāra. 62 Evaṃ ca jānīhi yathā, eteṣāṃ pūrvam, 63 na muktāḥ puruṣāḥ āsann ātmānaḥ."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Non lasciavam l’andar perch’ ei dicessi, 65 ma passavam la selva tuttavia, 66 la selva, dico, di spiriti spessi.
query.error: **English:** 64 We did not stop walking because he said this, 65 but we continued through the forest, 66 the forest, I say, of thick spirits.
query.result: 64 Na vyarāmavam gamanāt tena uktena, 65 Api tu vanam atīyāma sma nityam, 66 Vanam eva, vadāmi, ātmanām ghanānām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Non era lunga ancor la nostra via 68 di qua dal sonno, quand’ io vidi un foco 69 ch’emisperio di tenebre vincia.
query.error: **English:** 67 Our way was not long from there 68 beyond the sleep, when I saw a fire 69 that conquered a hemisphere of darkness.
query.result: 67 Na ca dirghā āsīt asmākam gatiḥ 68 tataḥ svapnāt pāre, yadā aham apaśyam agnim 69 yaḥ andhakārasya ardha-bhāgam ajayata.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Di lungi n’eravamo ancora un poco, 71 ma non sì ch’io non discernessi in parte 72 ch’orrevol gente possedea quel loco.
query.error: **English:** 70 We were still a little further away, 71 but not so far that I could not make out in part 72 what rebellious people possessed that place.
query.result: 70 Dūrataḥ asmākam adhunā alpam eva antarāsiṣṭam, 71 na tu tathā yathā aham na jānāmi अंशतः, 72 kaḥ vidrohi janaḥ adhikurute tat sthānam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 «O tu ch’onori scïenzïa e arte, 74 questi chi son c’hanno cotanta onranza, 75 che dal modo de li altri li diparte?».
query.error: **English:** 73 "O you who honor science and art, 74 who are these who have such great honor, 75 that it sets them apart from the others?"
query.result: 73 He vidyā-kalā-pūjaka, 74 ete ke ca bahu-mānam anubhvanti, 75 ye anyeṣām madhye viśiṣṭāḥ santi?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 E quelli a me: «L’onrata nominanza 77 che di lor suona sù ne la tua vita, 78 grazïa acquista in ciel che sì li avanza».
query.error: **English:** 76 And those to me: "The honored fame 77 that resounds of them up in your life, 78 acquires grace in heaven that so advances them."
query.result: 76 Te ca mama: "Pūjyā yaśaḥ 77 Yā teṣāṃ śruyate tava jīvite, 78 Anugrahaṃ prāpnoti svarge yaḥ evam teṣāṃ viśeṣaḥ."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Intanto voce fu per me udita: 80 «Onorate l’altissimo poeta; 81 l’ombra sua torna, ch’era dipartita».
query.error: **English:** 79 In the meantime, a voice was heard by me: 80 "Honor the most high poet; 81 his shade returns, which had departed".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 Poi che la voce fu restata e queta, 83 vidi quattro grand’ ombre a noi venire: 84 sembianz’ avevan né trista né lieta.
query.error: **English:** 82 After the voice had ceased and was quiet, 83 I saw four great shades coming towards us: 84 their appearance was neither sad nor happy.
query.result: 82 Tatas tadvacanaṃ niśāntam śāntam ca abhūt, 83 catasraś ca mahāntyaḥ chāyāḥ asmābhiḥ saha āgacchantyaḥ adṛkṣam, 84 ākṛtayaś ca tāḥ na duḥkhitāḥ na ca sukhitāḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Lo buon maestro cominciò a dire: 86 «Mira colui con quella spada in mano, 87 che vien dinanzi ai tre sì come sire:
query.error: **English:** 85 The good master began to say: 86 "Look at the one with that sword in his hand, 87 who comes before the three like a lord:
query.result: 85 Satguruḥ āha: 86 "Paśya tam khadgadharinam, 87 yaḥ trayāṇāṃ agre āgacchati yathā svāmī:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Però che ciascun meco si convene 92 nel nome che sonò la voce sola, 93 fannomi onore, e di ciò fanno bene».
query.error: **English:** 91 Because each one of them agrees with me 92 in the name that was the only voice, 93 they honor me, and they do well in that.
query.result: 91 Tataśca ye ye mayā saha samgacchanti 92 nāma yenaikam eva śabdam āśritya, 93 te mām pūjayanti, tatra ca satkṛtyaṃ kurvanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Così vid’ i’ adunar la bella scola 95 di quel segnor de l’altissimo canto 96 che sovra li altri com’ aquila vola.
query.error: **English:** 94 Thus I saw the fair school assemble 95 of that lord of the loftiest song 96 who soars above the rest like an eagle.
query.result: 94 Evam adṛkṣam ādadhānāṃ śobhanīṃ śālāṃ 95 tasya svāminaḥ śreṣṭhasya gānasya 96 yaḥ anyeṣāṃ upari yathā śyenaḥ patati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Da ch’ebber ragionato insieme alquanto, 98 volsersi a me con salutevol cenno, 99 e ’l mio maestro sorrise di tanto;
query.error: **English:** 97 After they had reasoned together for a while, 98 they turned to me with a welcoming gesture, 99 and my master smiled at this;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 e più d’onore ancora assai mi fenno, 101 ch’e’ sì mi fecer de la loro schiera, 102 sì ch’io fui sesto tra cotanto senno.
query.error: **English:** 100 and they did me even greater honor, 101 for they made me one of their company, 102 so that I was sixth among so much wisdom.
query.result: 100 tataś ca mama adhikaḥ sammānaḥ kṛtaḥ, 101 mama api tadīya gaṇe sthānaṃ dattvā, 102 aham ca ṣaṣṭhaḥ abhavam tāvatsu vijñāneṣu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Così andammo infino a la lumera, 104 parlando cose che ’l tacere è bello, 105 sì com’ era ’l parlar colà dov’ era.
query.error: **English:** 103 Thus we went on until we reached the light, 104 speaking of things which it is beautiful to keep silent about, 105 just as it was beautiful to speak there where I was.
query.result: 103 Evam gacchāvahe yaḥyāvan na prapya jyotih, 104 kathāḥ kurvāṇau yāḥ śobhanāḥ śāntāḥ, 105 yathā śobhanam āsīt tatra kathanaṃ yatra āsam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Venimmo al piè d’un nobile castello, 107 sette volte cerchiato d’alte mura, 108 difeso intorno d’un bel fiumicello.
query.error: **English:** 106 We came to the foot of a noble castle, 107 encircled seven times by high walls, 108 defended all around by a beautiful stream.
query.result: 106 Āgamismaḥ pādayoḥ ekasya kulaśreṣṭhasya, 107 sapta vārobhiḥ āvṛtasya unnataiḥ prākārair, 108 rakṣitasya sarvataḥ ekasmin sundare nadi-pravāheṇa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Questo passammo come terra dura; 110 per sette porte intrai con questi savi: 111 giugnemmo in prato di fresca verdura.

Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Genti v’eran con occhi tardi e gravi, 113 di grande autorità ne’ lor sembianti: 114 parlavan rado, con voci soavi.
query.error: **English:** 112 There were people there with slow and grave eyes, 113 of great authority in their appearance: 114 they spoke rarely, with gentle voices.
query.result: 112 Jantāḥ āsann atra dṛṣṭyā vilambitayā ca guruṇayā ca, 113 mahatāḥ adhikārasya teṣām ābhāseṣu: 114 vakṣyanti alpam, vāgbhiḥ saumabhyaiḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Traemmoci così da l’un de’ canti, 116 in loco aperto, luminoso e alto, 117 sì che veder si potien tutti quanti.
query.error: **English:** 115 We thus emerged from one of the banks, 116 into an open, bright, and lofty place, 117 so that we could see all of ourselves.
query.result: 115 Tathā tayor ekasmāt tīrāt prakramaṇam kṛtvā, 116 viveke prakāśamāne uttame sthāne, 117 yatra sarve api anyonyam paśyitum śaknuvanti sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Colà diritto, sovra ’l verde smalto, 119 mi fuor mostrati li spiriti magni, 120 che del vedere in me stesso m’essalto.
query.error: **English:** 118 There, straight ahead, upon the verdant enamel, 119 the great spirits were shown to me, 120 which in seeing them I exalt myself.
query.result: 118 Tataḥ sammukham, harita-smalake, 119 mayā mahātmānaḥ prakāśitāḥ, 120 yeṣām darśanena aham ātmānam utkarṣayāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 I’ vidi Eletra con molti compagni, 122 tra ’ quai conobbi Ettòr ed Enea, 123 Cesare armato con li occhi grifagni.
query.error: **English:** 121 I saw Electra with many companions, 122 among whom I recognized Hector and Aeneas, 123 Caesar in armor with his piercing eyes.
query.result: 121 Aham adṛśam Elektrām saha anekaih sahacāraih, 122 Yatra jñātavān aham Hekṭoram ca Aenēām ca, 123 Caeṣaram astradhāriṇam saha tejaskaribhyām netrabhyām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Vidi Cammilla e la Pantasilea; 125 da l’altra parte vidi ’l re Latino 126 che con Lavina sua figlia sedea.
query.error: **English:** 124 I saw Camilla and Penthesilea; 125 on the other side I saw King Latinus 126 who sat with his daughter Lavinia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Vidi quel Bruto che cacciò Tarquino, 128 Lucrezia, Iulia, Marzïa e Corniglia; 129 e solo, in parte, vidi ’l Saladino.
query.error: **English:** 127 I saw that Brutus who drove out Tarquin, 128 Lucretia, Julia, Martia, and Cornelia; 129 and by himself, in a place apart, I saw Saladin.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Poi ch’innalzai un poco più le ciglia, 131 vidi ’l maestro di color che sanno 132 seder tra filosofica famiglia.
query.error: **English:** 130 Then, when I had raised my eyes a little higher, 131 I saw the master of those who know, 132 sitting among the family of philosophers.
query.result: 130 Tataḥ kadācid uccatarāṇi cakṣūṃṣi kṛtvā, 131 Paśyāmi jñānināṃ gurum, 132 Tattvajñāninasamūhe nīvītam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 Tutti lo miran, tutti onor li fanno: 134 quivi vid’ ïo Socrate e Platone, 135 che ’nnanzi a li altri più presso li stanno;
query.error: **English:** 133 Everyone looks at him, everyone honors him: 134 there I saw Socrates and Plato, 135 who stand before the others, closer to him;
query.result: 133 Sarve tam paśyanti, sarve tasmai mānam kurvanti: 134 tatra aham adṛkṣam Sokrātam ca Platonaṃ ca, 135 ye anyebhyaḥ pūrvaṃ sthitavanto 'san.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 Democrito che ’l mondo a caso pone, 137 Dïogenès, Anassagora e Tale, 138 Empedoclès, Eraclito e Zenone;
query.error: **English:** 136 Democritus, who posits that the world is random, 137 Diogenes, Anaxagoras, and Thales, 138 Empedocles, Heraclitus, and Zeno;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 e vidi il buono accoglitor del quale, 140 Dïascoride dico; e vidi Orfeo, 141 Tulïo e Lino e Seneca morale;
query.error: **English:** 139 and I saw the good gatherer of whom 140 I speak, Dioscorides; and I saw Orpheus, 141 Tully and Linus and Seneca the moralist;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 Euclide geomètra e Tolomeo, 143 Ipocràte, Avicenna e Galïeno, 144 Averoìs, che ’l gran comento feo.
query.error: **English:** 142 Euclid the geometer and Ptolemy, 143 Hippocrates, Avicenna, and Galen, 144 Averroës, who wrote the great commentary.
query.result: 142 Ūklīdēn jyamitimānaṃ, Tōlamēyam ca, 143 Hippokratēn, Avicēnnam, Galēnam ca, 144 Avērōēṣam yaḥ mahān bhāṣyaṃ cakāra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
145 Io non posso ritrar di tutti a pieno, 146 però che sì mi caccia il lungo tema, 147 che molte volte al fatto il dir vien meno.
query.error: **English:** 145 I cannot recount all of them in full, 146 because the long theme so presses me, 147 that often the words fail to match the deeds.
query.result: 145 Sarvāṇyapi tāni pūrṇataḥ na śakyante mayā varṇayitum, 146 Yataḥ dīrghaḥ viṣayaḥ evam mām ākrāmati, 147 Yataḥ anekaśaḥ kathane satyam api mithyā bhavati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
148 La sesta compagnia in due si scema: 149 per altra via mi mena il savio duca, 150 fuor de la queta, ne l’aura che trema.
query.error: **English:** 148 The sixth company divides itself into two: 149 the wise leader takes me by another way, 150 out of the quiet, into the trembling air.
query.result: 148 Ṣaṣṭhaḥ saṅghaḥ dveṣu viyujyate: 149 anyena mārgeṇa māṃ neṣyati vidvān netr̥, 150 śāntāt bahiḥ, kampamānāṃ vāyum prati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
151 E vegno in parte ove non è che luca.
query.error: **English:** 151 And I came to a place where there is no light.
query.result: 151 Evaṃ ca tasmin sthāne āgato 'smi yatra na kaścid bhāḥ asti.
